comment_comments: Entries like this are comments, for readability. They are not necessary
to a functional jobspec, and are ignored during jobspec construction.
These comments generally appear below the material they're explaining,
and the substring in the key after the underscore also points to what

comment_valueTriggers: valueTriggers is a map of threshold functions to their parameters.
It cannot be empty. There can be more than one threshold function,
in which case all of them must trigger in order to trigger an update
comment_relativeThreshold: relativeThreshold triggers an update when the deviation between the
next and current values is greater than the threshold parameter as
as a percentage times the current value. E.g. current=1, new=1.006
will trigger if threshold < 0.6, because 0.6% = 0.006 and
relativeThreshold always triggers. Does not trigger if current=new=0
comment_absoluteThreshold: absoluteThreshold triggers an update when the deviation between the
next and current values is greater than the threshold parameter.
E.g. current=1, new=1.006 will trigger if threshold < 0.006
